text: In The Innovator’s Dilemma, Clayton Christensen explores why successful companies often fail to adapt to disruptive innovations. He discusses the case of the disk-drive industry, where smaller firms introduced cheaper, less efficient products that eventually overtook the established market leaders. Christensen explains that these larger companies focused on improving their current products to satisfy their existing customers, while ignoring new technologies that initially seemed less profitable. This shift in focus ultimately led to the downfall of industry giants. Christensen argues that innovation must be embraced even when it challenges existing business models. This observation suggests that ______.
question: Which choice most logically completes the text?
A: successful companies should ignore new technologies and focus solely on improving their existing products.
B: large companies must prioritize their current customers’ needs over any potential disruptive innovations.
C: companies should only pursue new technologies if they are immediately profitable and align with existing business models.
D: ignoring disruptive innovations can lead to the decline of even the most successful companies.
explanation:
Choice C is the best answer. Christensen argues that ignoring disruptive innovations, even for successful companies, can lead to their decline.Choice A is incorrect. The passage stresses that ignoring new technologies in favor of existing products can harm a company’s ability to compete.Choice B is incorrect. While large companies do focus on their current customers, the text suggests this focus can be detrimental in the long run when disruptive innovations emerge.Choice D is incorrect. The passage emphasizes that companies should embrace innovation even when it seems less profitable at first, making this statement misleading.
